results.title: Wake up call
results.creator_credit: Jack Pearce, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: While Jack Pearce may have missed the war, there was still plenty of dangerous work for him to do, clearing mines up the Queensland coast for the Australian Navy.

results.title: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis is the current Chair for the Federation of Ethnic Communities’ Councils of Australia (FECCA) an Honour Roll inductee and Member of the Order of Australia (AM). She co-founded the Victorian Immigrant and Refugee Women’s Coalition (VIRWC) and has served as Chair of the Immigrant Women’s Domestic Violence Service, as Inaugural Chair of the Women in the North Service, as Council member at the RMIT University, as well as on a number of State and Federal advisory and policy structures.

results.title: Growing up fast
results.creator_credit: John Croxford, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It was itchy feet that encouraged John Croxford to join the Australian Navy. He spent most of his time patrolling the Korean coast where there was no room for mistakes.

results.title: A Day to remember
results.brief_description: A young CFA volunteer who spent her 21st birthday on duty during the bushfires of February 2009. Her entire family is involved in the CFA as volunteer firefighters. She speaks about the poignancy of seeing an Australian flag on a resident’s home during ‘Black Saturday’.

results.title: Game Masters: Tim Schafer interview
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, ACMI Content Development, ACMI Media Studio and ACMI
results.brief_description:
In this interview, featured as part of the Game Masters exhibition, Tim Schafer speaks about his career as a game designer, starting at LucasArts and then founding his own production company Double Fine Productions. Tim discusses his influences, drawn heavily from the cultural folk law of Mexico, the psychological study of dreams, his love of heavy metal music and the writing of Raymond Chandler and Kurt Vonnegut Jr. With the progression of emerging technology his game aesthetics and character development have evolved, cementing Tim Schafer and Double Fine Productions’ place in games history.

Tim talks about his inspirations and work practices in developing the following games: ‘Full Throttle’, ‘Grim Fandango’, ‘Psychonauts’ and ‘Brutal Legend’. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Game Masters: Rob Murray interview
results.brief_description:
In this interview, featured as part of the ‘Game Masters’ exhibition, Rob Murray speaks about his career as a game designer. Starting out as a solo developer for hire to becoming CEO of Firemint, Murray is one of the most successful indie game developers in existence.

Firemint’s success is due to Murray’s vision to create games such as ‘Flight Control’(2009) and’ Real Racing’ (2009), which are both easy to play and elegant and addictive in equal measure. In addition, his prescient reading of the drive towards personalised gaming, led by the ubiquity of social networking on mobile platforms, has kept his games on trend – ‘Flight Control’, for example, allows players to choose music from their personal libraries to accompany the game.

Rob talks about the rise of mobile based gaming and the development of ‘Flight Control’ and ‘Real Racing’ .

results.title: Dr Isabel Joy Bear
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Isabel Joy Bear began her extensive career in science in the 1940s and today is an Honorary Fellow with CSIRO Minerals. In the 1960s Bear discovered a number of previously unknown metastable zirconium sulfate hydrates. Joy was appointed a Member of the Order of Australia in 1986 for services to science, particularly in the field of mineral chemistry. She is a fellow of both the Royal Australian Chemical Institute (RACI) and the Australasian Institute of Mining and Metallurgy, and in 1988 became the first woman to receive the Leighton Medal - the RACI’s premier award.

results.title: Interview with Christopher Doyle
results.brief_description:
Australian cinematographer Christopher Doyle talks about how time operates in his filmmaking, how life experience has shaped his work, the role of repetition, structure and movement in cinematogrpahy, how space informs and influences his technique, and about the collaborative process of filmmaking.
Includes clips from ‘Paranoid Park’ 2007; ‘Days of Being Wild’ (A Fei zheng chuan), 1990; ‘Happy Together’ (Chun gwong cha sit), 1997; ‘In the Mood for Love’ (Fa yeung nin wa), 2000; and ‘Fallen Angels’ (Duo luo tian shi), 1995.

results.title: Game Masters: Tetsuya Mizuguchi interview
results.creator_credit: Jim Arneman, ACMI Content Development, ACMI Media Studio and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Tetsuya Mizuguchi started in the industry working for SEGA developing arcade games such as ‘Sega Rally’. In 1994 he was inspired by the street parades in Zurich and soon turned his love of synaesthesia, combining sound and vision, to produce the games ‘Rez’ and ‘Space Channel 5’. Mizuguchi continues to incorporate a notable emphasis on interactive sound design, with his latest game ‘Child of Eden’.

Currently he is co-founder of the videogame development firm Q Entertainment. NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.
